ko: 톰은 자기가 예전에 테러 단체에 있었다는 걸 메리한테 고백하려고 있는 용기를 다 짜냈어.

en: I think Tom likes Mary.
ko: 내 생각엔 톰이 메리를 좋아하는 것 같아.

en: I think Tom could accomplish just about anything he decides to do.
ko: 내 생각에 톰은 자기가 하기로 마음먹은 건 뭐든 해낼 수 있을 거야.

en: I could kick myself for not inviting Tom and Mary to my party.
ko: 파티에 톰이랑 메리를 초대 안 한 게 너무 후회돼.

en: How long have you known Tom?
ko: 톰이랑 알고 지낸 지 얼마나 됐어?

en: Do you think I should tell Tom?
Convincing Tom to do the right thing was hard.
ko: 톰이 옳은 일을 하도록 설득하는 건 힘들었어.

en: After Tom dumped Mary, she started seeing John.
ko: 톰이 메리를 차고 나서 메리는 존을 만나기 시작했어.

en: A young boy, who couldn't have been more than five years old, asked Tom how to get to the post office.
ko: 다섯 살도 안 돼 보이는 꼬마가 톰한테 우체국에 어떻게 가는지 물어봤어.

en: You should eat more.
You need to relax.
Where did you get this list?
Washing the car took longer than we expected.
There's something I need to tell you before you leave.
There are some things that you should never try doing.
ko: 절대 해서는 안 되는 일들이 몇 가지 있어.

en: No matter what I try, I can't seem to give up smoking.
ko: 아무리 애를 써도 담배를 못 끊겠어.

en: It's difficult to help people when they don't want your help.
ko: 도움을 원하지 않는 사람을 돕는 건 힘든 일이야.

en: I'm willing to take care of your children, if you want me to.
ko: 원한다면 내가 애들 봐줄 수 있어.

en: I'm just not cut out for this kind of work.
ko: 난 이런 일에는 진짜 소질이 없나 봐.

en: I'll be back.
I wish I had a reason not to go.
ko: 안 가도 될 핑계가 있으면 좋겠다.

en: I don't want to talk about it.
I don't know what this means.
I could kick myself for not bringing a map.
ko: 지도를 안 가져오다니 내가 정말 바보 같아.

en: Do you have any plans for tonight?
Cleaning the garage wasn't much fun.
Man is the only animal subject to becoming an imbecile.
ko: 인간은 멍청해질 수 있는 유일한 동물이야.

en: I'll do my best to have no regrets.
My mother is making dinner.
Since he was able to walk so far, he must have strong legs.
ko: 그 먼 거리를 걸어온 걸 보면 다리가 정말 튼튼한가 봐.

en: Back when there were still hundred yen bills, the American dollar was worth 360 yen.
I took today off in exchange for working on Sunday.
If you don't put on hand cream, your hands will get dry.
ko: 핸드크림 안 바르면 손이 거칠어질 거야.

en: I was worried that I was going to be late when I missed my train, but I managed to get there just in time!
ko: 기차 놓쳐서 늦을까 봐 걱정했는데 다행히 제시간에 딱 맞춰 도착했어!

en: What are you eating?
This pleases me.
That's a lemon tree.
That's a blue house.
The man is a woman.
Frank eats some cheese.
I'm Korean.
I like China.
He really likes the United States.
Do you like tea?
I don't like this book.
ko: 나 이 책 별로 안 좋아해.

en: Do you like your boss?
Do you like Chinese food?
I really like my coworkers.
ko: 난 우리 직장 동료들이 정말 좋아.

en: Do you like my friend?
Do you like school?
That's a tree.
We are here.
I ate.
I will eat.
This is me eating a banana.
ko: 이거 나 바나나 먹고 있는 사진이야.

en: He is Ramudu.
Read this.
Bring tea.
Its long neck resembles that of a horse.
I need some nutmeg.
Congratulations on your face.
How do you want your steak?
It's OK with me if we barbecue, but I don't like it when smoke gets in my eyes.
ko: 바베큐 하는 건 좋은데 연기가 눈에 들어오는 건 싫어.

en: You should stay away from Takashi for now. He has a work interview tomorrow or something, and he's really tense.
ko: 당분간 타카시 근처에는 안 가는 게 좋을 거야. 내일 면접인가 뭔가 있다고 하더라고, 그래서 엄청 예민해져 있어.

en: You know, the ones where you skewer some marshmallows and roast them. I don't know what they're called but they're really good. Let's try roasting some at my place sometime, too.
ko: 왜 있잖아, 마시멜로 꼬치에 꽂아서 구워 먹는 거. 이름은 뭔지 모르겠는데 진짜 맛있거든. 우리 집에서도 언제 한번 구워 먹어 보자.

en: His advice didn't help at all.
ko: 걔 조언은 하나도 도움이 안 됐어.

en: That school looks just like a prison.
Why is the car in front driving so slowly? I'm going to be late for work.
ko: 앞차는 왜 이렇게 느릿느릿 가는 거야? 나 출근 늦겠어.

en: We see what we want to see.
ko: 사람은 보고 싶은 것만 보는 법이야.

en: She's good at tennis.
My leg's gone to sleep, so I don't think I can stand up right away.
ko: 다리에 쥐 나서 바로 못 일어날 것 같아.

en: My leg's gone to sleep, so whatever you do, don't touch my leg now.
ko: 다리에 쥐 났으니까 절대로 내 다리 건드리지 마.

en: Please don't make me laugh. I did too many sit-ups yesterday and my stomach muscles hurt.
ko: 제발 웃기지 좀 마. 어제 윗몸 일으키기 너무 많이 해서 배 당긴단 말이야.

en: I'm begging you. Don't make me laugh. I did too many sit-ups yesterday and my stomach muscles hurt.
ko: 진짜 부탁인데 웃기지 마. 어제 윗몸 일으키기 너무 많이 해서 배 아파 죽겠어.

en: I saw many people who had no clothes and I saw many clothes which had no people in them.
ko: 옷 없는 사람들도 많이 봤고 사람이 안 들어있는 옷들도 많이 봤어.

en: Tom pretended he didn't understand what Mary wanted him to do.
ko: 톰은 메리가 시키려는 일을 못 알아듣는 척했어.

en: Don't play dumb. Answer my question properly!
ko: 시치미 떼지 말고 내 질문에 제대로 대답해!

en: The truth is that I lied.
Tom does not like this color.
I play tennis after school.
That's none of your business!
He learned that poem by heart when he was five years old.
ko: 걔는 다섯 살 때 그 시를 다 외웠어.

en: He memorized that poem when he was five years old.
ko: 걔는 다섯 살 때 그 시를 외웠어.

en: It doesn't matter how much you keep saying this is your house, please stop walking around naked.
ko: 여기가 네 집이라고 아무리 그래도 벌거벗고 돌아다니는 것 좀 그만해.

en: Even if it's your own house, please stop walking around naked.
ko: 아무리 네 집이라도 벌거벗고 돌아다니지 마.

en: No matter how much you keep saying this is your house, please stop walking around naked.
ko: 아무리 여기가 네 집이라고 우겨봐도 소용없으니까 벌거벗고 돌아다니는 것 좀 그만해.

en: What's wrong with being nude in your own house?
ko: 자기 집에서 발가벗고 있는 게 뭐가 어때서?

en: I don't know the Latin language.
The fish can swim.
It occured to me that my sentences may never be translated.
ko: 내 문장들이 영영 번역되지 않을 수도 있겠다는 생각이 들었어.

en: Their hats are hanging over there.
The sunny side of the hill is full of deciduous trees.
Jump!
Come over here.
I have brought my shoes, coat and umbrella.
Where is the bus?
Where does that idiot think he is going?
ko: 저 바보는 대체 어디로 가는 거야?

en: Your cell phone rang a minute ago.
Tom sketched a picture of an elephant for Mary.
Tom read somewhere that short people need more sleep than tall people.
ko: 톰이 어디서 읽었는데, 키 작은 사람이 키 큰 사람보다 잠을 더 많이 자야 한대.

en: Tom put a Band-Aid over his small tattoo of a spider so he would be allowed into a Japanese hot spring.
ko: 톰은 일본 온천에 들어가려고 작은 거미 문신 위에 밴드를 붙였어.

en: She says she likes flowers.
You wanna arm wrestle?
What's wrong with running around your house naked?
ko: 자기 집에서 발가벗고 뛰어다니는 게 뭐가 문제야?

en: What's wrong with parading around your own house naked?
ko: 자기 집에서 벌거벗고 활개 치는 게 어때서 그래?

en: Years ago, when Tom's children were young, he used to take a lot of pictures.
ko: 몇 년 전 톰의 아이들이 어렸을 때 톰은 사진을 정말 많이 찍었어.

en: Did you hear about Tom's resignation?
Does Tom always carry a gun?
It never occurred to me that Tom might not be telling the truth.
ko: 톰이 거짓말을 하고 있을 수도 있다는 생각은 꿈에도 못 했어.

en: Mr Briggs is not any doctor, he is an excellent surgeon.
ko: 브리그스 씨는 그냥 의사가 아니라 아주 훌륭한 외과 의사야.

en: I don't want any sugar.
Monica doesn't study a lot.
Tom ate at a new restaurant the other day, but he doesn't remember the restaurant's name.
ko: 톰이 저번에 새로 생긴 식당에서 밥을 먹었는데, 그 식당 이름을 기억 못 해.

en: She has a very open personality.
The house next door is a bit loud. I wonder if they're throwing a party.
ko: 옆집이 좀 시끄럽네. 파티라도 하는 걸까?

en: Hearing that a transfer student was coming, the class buzzed with excitement.
ko: 전학생이 온다는 소리에 반 전체가 들썩였어.

en: The rain that was drizzling when I got on to the train is now pouring.
ko: 기차 탈 때만 해도 보슬보슬 내리던 비가 지금은 억수같이 쏟아져.

en: The kids that had been so lively when they were awake are now silently sleeping soundly.
ko: 깨어있을 땐 그렇게 시끄럽던 애들이 지금은 아주 곤히 자고 있어.

en: When I see the soundly sleeping face of my daughter, I think, "I will give it my all tomorrow, too."
ko: 우리 딸 곤히 자는 모습 보면 '내일도 진짜 열심히 해야지' 하는 생각이 들어.

en: If it didn't need to be done, nobody would do this kind of thing.
ko: 굳이 안 해도 되는 일이면 아무도 이런 거 안 할 거야.

en: An ash-colored rabbit appeared and as soon as I drew near, it hopped and ran into the woods again.
ko: 회색 토끼 한 마리가 나타나더니 내가 가까이 가자마자 깡충깡충 숲속으로 다시 도망갔어.

en: Why is she here?
The bread I got from my neighbor, Mr. Yamada, had a soft texture, and my father, who prefers hard bread, was sure to dislike it.
ko: 이웃집 야마다 씨한테 받은 빵은 식감이 부드러웠는데, 딱딱한 빵을 좋아하시는 우리 아빠는 분명 안 좋아하셨을 거야.

en: Since my husband became sick he's lost 20 kilograms and his pants are now baggy.
ko: 남편이 아프고 나서 살이 20킬로나 빠지는 바람에 바지가 헐렁해졌어.

en: Since my husband became sick he's lost as much as 20 kilograms and his pants are now baggy.
ko: 남편이 아프고 나서 살이 무려 20킬로나 빠지는 바람에 바지가 아주 헐렁헐렁해.

en: He was confused by something, as though he wasn't used to this kind of restaurant, but I stayed clear of him by pretending that I, too, wasn't used to the restaurant.
ko: 그 사람은 이런 식당이 익숙하지 않은지 좀 당황해 보였는데, 나도 익숙하지 않은 척하면서 거리를 뒀어.

en: My little sister's hobby is designing icons on the web, and she distributes them free of charge on her website whenever she finds the free time to do so.
ko: 내 여동생 취미가 웹 아이콘 디자인인데, 틈날 때마다 자기 사이트에 무료로 배포해.

en: There are nine million bicycles in Beijing.
The soup is too hot.
Black cats are bad luck.
The cat is black.
Please speak slowly and clearly.
I don't have a friend with whom I can talk about this.
I didn't know that you were seeing someone.
There are two staircases in my house.
ko: 우리 집에는 계단이 두 개 있어.

en: The first things that you hear when you arrive at Las Vegas are the dings of the slot machines.
ko: 라스베이거스에 도착하면 가장 먼저 들리는 게 슬롯머신 소리야.

en: Critique of Pure Reason is German philosopher Immanuel Kant's chief literary work.
I'm on my way out.
He's very influential in Kansai's adult industry.
ko: 그 사람은 간사이 성인 산업에서 영향력이 엄청나.

en: Ecstasy is a stimulant type of drug.
My cat is wet.
The hospital that I went to for my allergies recommended me a shampoo that wouldn't trigger them. It's certainly effective - I think - but it's just way too expensive.
ko: 알레르기 때문에 간 병원에서 자극 없는 샴푸를 추천받았어. 효과는 확실히 있는 것 같은데 너무 비싸.

en: I was planning to turn this room into my mother's studio, but I'm currently using it as a storage room.
ko: 이 방을 원래 엄마 작업실로 만들려고 했는데, 지금은 그냥 창고로 쓰고 있어.

en: There was a single oil painting left unfinished in the studio. No other pictures were there.
ko: 작업실에는 미완성된 유화 한 점만 덩그러니 남아 있었어. 다른 그림은 없었고.

en: Hurray!
Open fire!
I'm so hungry.
Have you found the umbrella you said you had lost the other day?
Tom is the type of person who always demands that something be done rather than request that it be done.
ko: 톰은 뭘 부탁하기보다 항상 시키는 타입이야.

en: Tom seems to enjoy provoking arguments.
ko: 톰은 싸움 거는 걸 즐기는 것 같아.

en: I used to watch this anime a lot when I was a kid, but I can't quite remember what happened to the hero in the final episode.
ko: 어릴 때 이 애니메이션 진짜 많이 봤는데, 마지막 회에서 주인공이 어떻게 됐는지는 기억이 잘 안 나.

en: How many died?
I'm not stupid.
I'm not as stupid as you think I am.
ko: 나 네가 생각하는 것만큼 바보 아니야.

en: Tom hates going to school.
ko: 톰은 학교 가는 거 진짜 싫어해.

en: How many people died?
Tom doesn't like people who manipulate others.
ko: 톰은 사람 조종하려는 사람을 안 좋아해.

en: Do you have any idea how many people died when the Titanic sunk?
ko: 타이타닉호가 침몰했을 때 얼마나 많은 사람이 죽었는지 알아?

en: It's been a long time since I last spoke French.
ko: 프랑스어 안 쓴 지 진짜 오래됐다.

en: It's been a long time since I've had a real vacation.
ko: 제대로 된 휴가 가본 지 진짜 오래됐네.

en: He's your father.
The new Mario game is an underwater adventure where he solves the mystery of an ancient kingdom sunk to the bottom of the sea.
ko: 새로 나온 마리오 게임은 바닷속에 가라앉은 고대 왕국의 수수께끼를 푸는 수중 어드벤처야.

en: Tom is very popular.
I'm relieved to hear that.
Try to find it.
You're pretty good.
Sorry, I forgot.
I changed my mind.
Why didn't you tell us about this sooner?
ko: 왜 이걸 우리한테 더 빨리 말 안 해줬어?

en: Why didn't you tell me about this sooner?
ko: 왜 이걸 나한테 더 빨리 말 안 해줬어?

en: I twisted my ankle.
When he gets overtaken by another car, he gets a shot of adrenaline.
ko: 그는 다른 차한테 추월당하면 아드레날린이 솟구쳐.

en: Her ideal type seems to be someone like the announcer Shinichiro Azumi.
ko: 걔 이상형은 아즈미 신이치로 아나운서 같은 사람인가 봐.

en: If I think about an old lady from Osaka, the image of someone wearing clothes with an animal pattern comes to mind.
ko: 오사카 아줌마 하면 동물 문양 옷을 입은 이미지가 떠올라.

en: The two met each other at a vocational college for animation.
He'll run out of luck sooner or later.
I go to cabarets two times a week, but I have no interest in after-hours.
ko: 일주일에 두 번 카바레에 가지만, 애프터에는 관심 없어.

en: Right now, I'm not using Mixi at all. I just play games on it sometimes.
ko: 요즘 믹시(Mixi) 아예 안 해. 가끔 게임만 해.

en: My grandpa is good at shogi. His level is fourth dan, amateur.
ko: 우리 할아버지는 장기를 잘 두셔. 아마추어 4단이셔.

en: Even though I decided to hang the laundry outside because the sun was shining, just as I was hanging them, it started to rain.
ko: 날씨가 맑아서 빨래를 밖에 널려고 했는데, 널자마자 비가 오기 시작하네.

en: That damn Kenji, because he was cheating on me with another woman, I slapped him as hard as I could. I've already broken up with him.
ko: 그놈의 켄지가 다른 여자랑 바람피워서 뺨을 세게 때려줬어. 이미 헤어졌어.

en: My dad keeps on telling bad jokes like: "Are you tired of going to Akita?".
ko: 우리 아빠는 "아키타에 가니까 아키타(질렸다)?" 같은 썰렁한 농담을 계속해.

en: My dad keeps on telling bad jokes like: "Are you fed up of going to Fedup's?".
ko: 우리 아빠는 "질려버린 곳에 가니까 질리냐?" 같은 썰렁한 농담을 계속해.

en: Why did you put the chicken in such a difficult place to get when you knew that I wanted to use it right away?
ko: 내가 바로 쓸 거 알면서 왜 닭고기를 그렇게 꺼내기 힘든 곳에 뒀어?

en: Oranges have a lot of vitamin C.
I'm afraid of heights.
I don't like iced coffee.
Tom is an excellent cricket player.
Is your dog mean?
We used to play musical chairs in elementary school.
ko: 초등학교 때 의자 뺏기 놀이 하곤 했어.

en: I froze the juice inside the PET bottle. This way, I'll be able to drink as much cold juice as I want at lunchtime.
ko: 페트병에 주스를 얼렸어. 이러면 점심때 시원한 주스를 마음껏 마실 수 있거든.

en: I wonder how tempura fry up so deliciously crisp and dry. Is there a trick to it?
ko: 튀김이 어떻게 그렇게 바삭하게 튀겨지는지 궁금해. 무슨 비결이라도 있어?

en: When the tempura I make cools down, it immediately loses its crispiness and doesn't taste very good.
ko: 내가 만든 튀김은 식으면 금방 눅눅해져서 별로 맛이 없어.

en: I don't fear death.
This chair is quite rickety when you sit on it. Should I fix it or buy a new one?
ko: 이 의자 앉으면 꽤 덜컹거리네. 고칠까 아니면 새로 살까?

en: How on earth could this pan become so burnt and blackened.
ko: 도대체 프라이팬이 어떻게 이렇게 시커멓게 탔어?

en: Drinking lots of water is good for you, sure, but one can't drink that much water at once.

ko: 나한테 필요한 건 맥주 한 잔이야.

en: "Has anybody called the police?" "I have."
I enjoy feeding the pigeons.
ko: 나 비둘기 먹이 주는 거 좋아해.

en: There are no drugs here.
You do the kitchen.
We waited a long time, but she didn't show up.
It's publicly recommended to "raise obedient kids," but it's rather difficult to carry that out.
ko: "말 잘 듣는 아이로 키우라"고들 하지만, 실제로 그러긴 꽤 힘들어.

en: Whenever you come home late, your parents will start harping you on it, and you'll find it unbearable. No matter how late it gets, they'll stay up just to wait for you. They should just go to sleep already, don't you think?
ko: 늦게 들어올 때마다 부모님이 잔소리하시면 진짜 못 참겠지. 아무리 늦어도 안 자고 기다리시잖아. 그냥 좀 주무시지, 안 그래?

en: Whenever I come home late at night, my parents scold me and it annoys me. No matter how late I come back, they're awake and waiting for me. It would be so nice if they just went to sleep instead.
ko: 밤늦게 들어오면 부모님이 잔소리해서 짜증 나. 아무리 늦어도 안 자고 기다리고 계시거든. 그냥 주무시면 참 좋을 텐데 말이야.

en: Is dad in the kitchen?
Her mother went to the United States to learn English.
ko: 걔네 엄마는 영어 배우러 미국 가셨어.

en: Your hair is pretty.
I was asleep when Mark arrived.
ko: 마크가 왔을 때 난 자고 있었어.

en: The Joker is the wild card, OK?
Does the Oedipus Complex apply to me, too? It sure doesn't feel like it, though.
ko: 나도 오이디푸스 콤플렉스인가? 딱히 그런 느낌은 안 드는데.

en: The many oil fences that were used in the Gulf of Mexico got recycled for parts that are now used in electric cars.
ko: 멕시코만에서 썼던 오일 펜스들이 재활용돼서 지금은 전기차 부품으로 쓰인대.

en: I got an ocarina from my daughter on Father's Day. Frankly, though, I don't need it. I wonder where she could have come up with such a present.
ko: 어버이날에 딸한테 오카리나를 받았는데, 사실 필요 없거든. 대체 어디서 그런 선물을 생각했는지 모르겠네.

en: I couldn't tell what kind of person this girl I met on the internet was from her profile, but something about her still piqued my curiosity, as though I had met her in a previous life, or something occult-ish like that, anyways.
ko: 인터넷에서 만난 이 여자애, 프로필만 봐선 어떤 애인지 잘 모르겠더라고. 근데 전생에서 만났던 것처럼 왠지 모르게 끌리는 게, 뭐랄까 좀 오컬트적인 느낌이 있었어.

en: If I change key, I can't hold the pitch. It's better if we go with the original key, and I sometimes sing an octave lower.
ko: 키를 바꾸면 음을 못 잡겠어. 그냥 원곡 키로 하고, 가끔 한 옥타브 낮춰서 부르는 게 나을 것 같아.

en: Naomi fell in the orchestra pit during her performance and broke her arm.
ko: 나오미가 공연하다가 오케스트라 피트에 떨어져서 팔이 부러졌대.

en: There were a lot of Australian teachers at the English conversation school I went to previously.
ko: 예전에 다녔던 영어 회화 학원에 호주 선생님들이 많았어.

en: There were a lot of teachers from Australia and New Zealand at the English conversation school I went to previously.
ko: 예전에 다녔던 영어 학원에 호주랑 뉴질랜드 출신 선생님들이 많았어.

en: My specialty is French onion gratin soup.
ko: 내 특기는 프랑스식 어니언 그라탱 수프야.

en: It was 30% off during the sale.
The CEO doesn't take his cellphone when he's not working.
ko: 사장님은 일 안 할 때는 휴대폰 안 들고 다녀.

en: An offside... No! We did it-!
Let's add ambiguous sentences more often.
ko: 애매한 문장들을 좀 더 자주 넣어보자.

en: It's presumptuous to say that it's "production". Isn't it more processing?
ko: 이걸 '생산'이라고 하기엔 좀 거창하지 않아? 그냥 '가공'에 가깝지 않나?

en: Playing, such as crumpling paper into a ball or tearing into pieces, helps develop children's creativity.
ko: 종이를 구기거나 찢으면서 노는 게 아이들 창의력 발달에 좋대.

en: I never want to see his face again, so I tore all of his pictures into pieces and burned them.
ko: 그 사람 얼굴 다시는 보기 싫어서 사진 다 찢어버리고 태웠어.

en: What should I do! I mistook my father's company documents for trash and crumpled them!
ko: 어떡해! 아빠 회사 서류를 쓰레기인 줄 알고 구겨버렸어!

en: It's still being tested.
I'll look it over later.
I want to style my hair so it's fluffy and feels snug.
ko: 머리를 좀 폭신하고 포근한 느낌으로 스타일링하고 싶어.

en: The world is harsh.
Nobody lives forever.
If you don't fold your clothes or hang them, they will be wrinkled.
ko: 옷 안 개어두거나 안 걸어놓으면 구겨져.

en: Don't ask the same thing over and over again. I explained it properly to you already. It's getting tedious.
ko: 자꾸 똑같은 거 묻지 마. 이미 제대로 설명했잖아. 이제 슬슬 짜증 나려고 해.

en: Is there gas inside the car?
I wonder how figure-skaters are able to keep from being dizzy when they spin really fast.
ko: 피겨 선수들은 그렇게 빨리 도는데 어떻게 안 어지러운지 신기해.

en: Japan's prime ministers change rapidly so I can't really remember each of their names.
ko: 일본 총리는 너무 자주 바뀌어서 이름을 다 못 외우겠어.

en: The doctor sent the live patient to the morgue.
It's polite to say "itadakimasu" before eating one's meal.
ko: 밥 먹기 전에 "잘 먹겠습니다"라고 말하는 게 예의야.

en: It's polite to say "Bon apétit" before eating one's meal.
ko: 식사 전에 "맛있게 드세요"라고 하는 게 예의지.

en: After finishing eating, one must say, "Thanks for the food."
ko: 다 먹고 나면 "잘 먹었습니다"라고 해야 해.

en: "Look at the time! I'm gonna be late for school! Bye!" "See you later. Be careful."
ko: "벌써 시간이 이렇게 됐네! 학교 늦겠다! 갈게!" "나중에 봐. 조심히 가."

en: Business is business!
Even though she's allergic, I gave an egg to the child.
I fell and broke my arm.
Don't mess around and finish your meal quickly.
Before you go play, do your homework.
We are learning Arabic.
The rescue operation was called "Operation Tomodachi".
Again, it's not a musical, it's an operetta!
It said "Oracle Master," so I thought it was something related to spirits, but no, it was only about computers. Boring.
ko: '오라클 마스터'라길래 무슨 영혼이랑 관련된 건 줄 알았더니, 그냥 컴퓨터 얘기더라. 노잼이야.

en: "What anthropoid would your girlfriend be most like?" "What a question... Well, um... An orangutan, I guess."
ko: "네 여자친구는 유인원 중에 뭘 제일 닮은 것 같아?" "질문 참... 음... 오랑우탄이려나."

en: I can't believe I didn't notice the earthquake in my sleep.
ko: 자느라 지진 난 것도 몰랐다니 믿기지가 않아.

en: Fever is one of the body's defence mechanisms.
ko: 열이 나는 건 몸의 방어 기제 중 하나야.

en: Only when I got sick as a kid that I could eat as much ice cream and jello as I wanted and not get yelled at.
ko: 어릴 땐 아파야만 아이스크림이랑 젤리를 혼 안 나고 마음껏 먹을 수 있었어.

en: Don't just sleep all day like some lion from the zoo. How about you go and clean up your room?
ko: 동물원 사자처럼 하루 종일 잠만 자지 말고 방 청소 좀 하는 게 어때?

en: There was a violent tremor during the night, so I was scared and couldn't sleep very well.
ko: 밤에 진동이 너무 심해서 무서워가지고 잠을 설쳤어.

en: I think that my costume for the upcoming Halloween party will be wrapping myself up in toilet paper like a mummy.
ko: 이번 할로윈 파티 때 휴지로 몸을 칭칭 감아서 미라 분장을 할까 봐.

en: I went around Hokkaido by bike this summer.
ko: 이번 여름에 자전거로 홋카이도 한 바퀴 돌았어.

en: We've walked all around the lake.
ko: 우리 호수 한 바퀴 다 돌았어.

en: I thought my son was being quite sneaky lately. Sure enough, I spotted him uploading a picture of himself cross-dressing and in makeup to a blog.
ko: 요즘 아들이 좀 수상하다 싶더니, 아니나 다를까 여장하고 화장까지 한 사진을 블로그에 올리는 걸 딱 걸렸지 뭐야.

en: As the room fall silent, only the ticking sound of an old clock could be heard.
ko: 방 안이 조용해지니까 오래된 시계의 째깍거리는 소리만 들리더라고.

en: Don't touch the container with the forbidden flies.
ko: 금지된 파리들이 들어있는 통은 건드리지 마.

en: He severely criticized the mayor.
ko: 그 사람이 시장을 엄청 세게 비판했어.

en: Junko is a beautiful girl.
Starting today, I'll save all my small change so I can buy some new game software.
ko: 오늘부터 잔돈 다 모아서 새 게임 소프트웨어 살 거야.

en: No matter what you're studying, I think it's best to study a little every day.
ko: 뭘 공부하든 매일 조금씩 하는 게 제일 좋은 것 같아.

en: The clicking of high heels kind of hurts my ears. Do the people wearing them not notice?
ko: 하이힐 또각거리는 소리가 좀 거슬려. 신은 사람들은 못 느끼나?

en: I was surprised that her hobby was karate. She always wears cute clothes.
ko: 걔 취미가 가라데라고 해서 놀랐어. 항상 귀여운 옷만 입고 다니거든.

en: I can't walk anymore, Dad! Carry me, please!
Daddy, I can't walk any more. Could you give me a piggyback ride?
ko: 아빠, 나 이제 더 못 걷겠어. 어부바해 주면 안 돼?

en: Daddy, I can't walk any more. Carry me.
The thief ran quickly.
Where did Joe go?
I'm so lost.
Is the entry form not working or is my Internet connection not working right?
ko: 신청서 양식이 안 되는 거야, 아니면 내 인터넷이 이상한 거야?

en: I just did a test and it's a bit slow but working fine.
ko: 방금 테스트해 봤는데, 좀 느리긴 해도 잘 돼.

en: Which browser are you using?
My legs are weak.
Magazines let writers write what they want and decide how to lay it out afterward, but that magazine prioritizes its design, so it sets a predetermined limit on how many words are in it.
ko: 보통 잡지는 쓰고 싶은 대로 쓰고 나중에 배치를 정하는데, 그 잡지는 디자인 위주라 글자 수 제한이 딱 정해져 있대.

en: It's because I found out that giving my all won't accomplish anything significant. I miss the good old days where I could just believe in myself.
ko: 최선을 다해도 별거 없다는 걸 알아버렸거든. 나 자신을 믿기만 하면 됐던 예전이 그립네.

en: The two lovers who eloped were crucified.
ko: 사랑해서 도망친 그 둘은 십자가형에 처해졌대.

en: The crime of adultery was abolished in 1947.
If you go into the forest, watch out for the man-eating ogres!
ko: 숲에 들어가면 사람 잡아먹는 괴물 조심해!

en: If you go into the forest, watch out for the ogres who eat children!
ko: 숲에 들어가면 아이 잡아먹는 괴물 조심해!

en: Who gave you such a rough time, and where? I'll beat him black and blue for you.
ko: 누가 어디서 널 괴롭혔어? 내가 가서 아주 반 죽여놓을게.

en: Today's stew has been carefully and slowly boiled to perfect deliciousness.
ko: 오늘 스튜는 정성 들여 푹 끓여서 진짜 맛있게 됐어.

en: Don't get such a big head just because you won the tournament. There's many others in the world who are just as good as you.
ko: 우승했다고 너무 우쭐대지 마. 세상엔 너만큼 잘하는 사람 널렸으니까.

en: I was getting close to the summit, but there were several boulders in my way, and trying to get over them almost did me in. Sometimes there were loose rocks all over the place, too.
ko: 정상 근처까지 갔는데 바위들이 앞을 막아서 넘어가느라 죽는 줄 알았어. 어떤 데는 돌멩이들이 막 굴러다니기도 하고.

en: I really like the crisp texture of gizzards.
ko: 난 닭모래집의 그 꼬들꼬들한 식감이 너무 좋아.

en: This city may be a little run-down, but the people living here are all kind, and will welcome anyone with open arms.
ko: 이 동네가 좀 허름하긴 해도 여기 사람들은 다 착해서 누구든 반갑게 맞아줘.

en: I don't like messy places like this. I'd rather live somewhere clean and peaceful.
ko: 난 이렇게 지저분한 데는 싫어. 차라리 깨끗하고 조용한 데서 살고 싶어.

en: There are many cute children in the world.
I have changed my mind.
Do I really have to give a speech?
I don't like this plain necktie. Please show me a more colourful one.
ko: 이 밋밋한 넥타이는 별로야. 좀 더 화려한 거 보여줘.

en: This novel isn't as good as his last one.
I thought it was absurd that you got punished.
ko: 네가 벌을 받다니 진짜 말도 안 된다고 생각했어.

en: This box is too heavy for me to carry.
ko: 이 상자 너무 무거워서 못 들겠어.

en: Please forget about the orienteering that you did at that outdoors school. Well, actually, you don't have to forget it, but the orienteering that we're doing here is completely different.
ko: 야외 학교에서 했던 오리엔티어링은 잊어버려. 뭐, 굳이 잊을 필요까지는 없지만, 여기서 하는 건 아예 딴판이거든.

en: Please, get in, sir.
I know nothing about constellations. I can only recognize Orion and Cassiopeia. Oh, and the Big Dipper, too.
ko: 난 별자리에 대해서는 하나도 몰라. 오리온이랑 카시오페아만 알아봐. 아, 북두칠성도!

en: My grandmother cannot see.
I found my boyfriend's favorite Beatles song playing from a music box. I'll be so happy to give it to him.
ko: 남자친구가 제일 좋아하는 비틀즈 노래가 나오는 오르골을 찾았어. 선물하면 진짜 좋아하겠다.

en: I try to watch live TV as much as possible instead of recordings.
ko: 난 녹화된 거 말고 웬만하면 본방사수하려고 해.

en: This fantasy book is a succession of really flashy magical spells and that makes it boring instead.
ko: 이 판타지 소설은 화려한 마법만 계속 나와서 오히려 더 지루해.

en: Try some of this cake.
These donuts, the outside breaks apart easily and the insides are light and fluffy, delicious!
ko: 이 도넛, 겉은 바삭하게 부서지는데 속은 진짜 폭신폭신하고 맛있다!

en: I have ten pens more than you do.
ko: 내가 너보다 펜 열 개 더 많아.

en: He was bewildered.
He was perplexed.
I wish I had a beautiful girlfriend.
I think my girlfriend is kind of cute.
ko: 내 여자친구 좀 귀여운 것 같아.

en: Tom's new girlfriend is quite attractive.
ko: 톰 새 여자친구 꽤 매력 있더라.

en: I can't understand her way of thinking at all.
ko: 걔 사고방식은 도무지 이해가 안 가.

en: What are you crying for?
Let's dance.
It's time for us to go.
It's almost time to go.
It would be nice to spend the summer in the mountains.
It never occurred to me that I might be wrong.
ko: 내가 틀렸을 거라곤 생각도 못 했어.

en: If there's anything I can do to help, please let me know.
ko: 내가 도와줄 수 있는 게 있으면 알려줘.

en: I'll give it a try.
I'll be in touch.
I won't be getting married this year. In fact, I may never get married.
ko: 나 올해는 결혼 안 할 거야. 사실 평생 안 할지도 몰라.

en: I need to go home.
I have many friends I can talk to.
I don't want to give up.
How was your trip?
He intends to visit his uncle.
He's considering visiting his uncle.
ko: 걔 삼촌 댁에 갈까 생각 중이래.

en: In other words, he's lazy.
Who knows what we'll find up in the attic?
From 1988 to 1994 he lived in Lebanon.
No sugar for you?
Don't leave me out in the cold, come on.
I was fired.
The travel agent suggested that we take some traveler's checks with us.
ko: 여행사 직원이 여행자 수표 좀 챙겨가라고 하더라.

en: I like watermelon.
What scared Tom the most was the thought that he might not be able to walk again.
ko: 톰을 제일 겁나게 했던 건 다시는 못 걸을 수도 있다는 생각이었어.

en: Tom would say yes.
Tom would like some coffee.
Tom watches too much television.
Tom wasn't the only one who showed up late.
Tom was wrong.
Tom was very lucky.
Tom was totally wasted.
Tom was tall and handsome.
Tom was shocked.
Tom was shivering with cold.
Tom was scared.
Tom was relieved to hear that.
Tom was my first boyfriend.
Tom was kidnapped.
Tom was John's roommate.
Tom was in the shower.
Tom was hurt.
Tom was hung up on Mary.
Tom was hoping that Mary would kiss him.
Tom was here yesterday.
Tom was happy.
Tom was frightened.
Tom was fast asleep.
Tom wants to marry Mary.
Tom wants to know your opinion.
ko: 톰은 네 의견을 알고 싶어 해.

en: Tom wants a microscope.
Tom wanted to wash his hands.
Tom turned on the TV.
Tom turned on the heater.
Tom tried to kiss Mary.
Tom took the wrong train.
Tom took Mary home.
Tom threw his back out.
Tom thought it was unfair.
Tom thought he would be late.
Tom thinks you're lying.
Tom thinks there's hope.
Tom thinks that's normal.
Tom talked in his sleep.
Tom stood in line.
Tom started crying.
Tom squeezed Mary's hand.
Tom split up with Mary.
Tom speaks French fluently.
Tom soaked in the bathtub.
Tom says he understands how you feel.
Tom said he'd pay for the entire thing.
ko: 톰은 자기가 전부 다 내겠다고 했어.

en: Tom is taking the day off today.
Tom is probably right.
Tom is fluent in French.
Tom inherited all of his father's property.
Tom asked for directions.
Tom and Mary both wanted to be astronauts.
ko: 톰이랑 메리 둘 다 우주비행사가 되고 싶어 했어.

en: It's possible that Tom lied to you.
How old do you think Tom is?
Here, let me take a stab at it.
I abstain from alcohol.
I may be unsociable, but it doesn't mean I don't talk to people.
ko: 내가 좀 비사교적일지는 몰라도, 사람들하고 말을 안 한다는 뜻은 아니야.

en: Nobody has ever done that.
Today isn't my lucky day!
I was just about to go to bed when he phoned me.
ko: 그 사람이 전화했을 때 막 자려던 참이었어.

en: I got a phone call from him just as I was about to go to bed.
ko: 막 자려던 참에 그 사람한테 전화가 왔어.

en: My grandmother's mother is my "great grandmother," so my great grandmother's mother is my "great great grandmother"? Is that right?
ko: 우리 할머니의 어머니는 '증조할머니'니까, 증조할머니의 어머니는 '고조할머니'인 거지? 그게 맞아?

en: I can't imagine a world without electricity.
ko: 전기 없는 세상은 상상도 할 수 없어.

en: We should help each other in times of need.
I could tell from his accent that he was a Frenchman.
ko: 억양을 들어보니 프랑스 사람인 걸 알겠더라고.

en: Is there an elevator here?
Do you have an elevator?
I'll do any kind of work.
I like cold milk, but not hot milk. The white membrane and the smell that develops bothers me.
ko: 난 찬 우유는 좋은데 따뜻한 우유는 싫어. 위에 생기는 하얀 막이랑 냄새가 거슬리거든.

en: What time do you usually eat breakfast?
Tom is a confirmed bachelor.
You can't judge a person based on clothing.
ko: 옷차림만 보고 사람을 판단하면 안 돼.

en: Don't be so hard on yourself.
We had hoped some students would come, but there was no one in the classroom.
ko: 학생들이 좀 오길 바랐는데 교실에 아무도 없었어.

en: Tom couldn't find a decent job in Boston, so he moved to Chicago.
ko: 탐은 보스턴에서 괜찮은 직장을 못 구해서 시카고로 이사했어.

en: If you want your workers to be happy, you need to pay them a decent wage.
ko: 직원들이 행복하게 일하길 원하면 월급을 제대로 줘야 해.

en: It's been a while. How are you?
I have the feeling that my French is improving slowly.
ko: 프랑스어 실력이 조금씩 늘고 있는 기분이 들어.

en: If you truly want to upgrade your language skills, then translation might not be the best way to do it, but you're really just playing around, so I believe that if you find it fun, then more power to you.
ko: 정말 언어 실력을 키우고 싶은 거라면 번역이 최선은 아닐 수도 있지만, 넌 그냥 즐기는 거니까 네가 재밌으면 그걸로 된 거지.

en: Do you have any recommendations for something to read on Aozora Bunko?
ko: 아오조라 문고에서 뭐 읽을지 추천 좀 해 줄래?

en: No fussing!
But you see, while other people may not know, in my case, if I just had the time, I'd be buried over my head in things I'd want to do. I don't have the time to not think about things I need or want.
ko: 근데 있잖아, 다른 사람들은 몰라도 내 경우엔 시간만 있으면 하고 싶은 일들에 파묻혀 지낼 거야. 내가 필요하거나 원하는 걸 생각하지 않을 틈이 없거든.

en: It was not my mistake.
It wasn't my mistake.
That doesn't mean that I'll stop doing it.
I did that without consulting anyone.
I did that without asking for anyone's advice.
ko: 누구한테 조언도 안 구하고 그냥 했어.

en: I did that without consulting anybody.
Tom will help you if you ask.
Tom will help you if you ask him to.
Tom will help you if you ask him.
Look, it's snowing!
We just played doctor.
I'm here on business.
I'm here for work.
You have a nice complexion.
Tom still lives with his parents.
How is your wife doing?
How old do I look?
In what month were you guys born?
I'm not twenty years old yet.
Do you have an elevator in your house?
I ate at the side of my friend.
Don't make me wait!
I want it.
A Noldo is beneath the tree.
Walls have ears.
ko: 낮말은 새가 듣고 밤말은 쥐가 들어.

en: Is this translation correct?
I sing now.
I think Tom hasn't left yet.
ko: 탐이 아직 안 떠난 것 같아.

en: What should I do in order to save time?
What should I do to save time?
He couldn't stand being away from his girlfriend.
ko: 걔는 여자친구랑 떨어져 있는 걸 못 견뎌 했어.

en: I'll go on Sunday.
Today is Thursday.
Michael is reading a book.
He never forgot his ambition to become a leading politician.
ko: 그는 최고의 정치인이 되겠다는 야망을 결코 잊지 않았어.

en: He thinks I love her.
ko: 걔는 내가 그 여자를 사랑하는 줄 알아.

en: There is no other choice.
Come to help me.
Come help me.
Come with me, please.
My brother is in Australia now.
My house is on a hill.
No, I'm not well.
It's great that my nephew and niece came over to play, but they're so annoying making such a racket running all over the house all day that I can't stand it.
ko: 조카들이 놀러 온 건 좋은데, 하루 종일 집안을 뛰어다니면서 시끄럽게 구니까 진짜 못 참겠어.

en: I expect everyday is chaos for families with small children.
ko: 어린 애들 있는 집은 매일매일이 전쟁터일 것 같아.

en: I have horrible morning sickness. I can't eat anything.
ko: 입덧이 너무 심해. 아무것도 못 먹겠어.

en: You're one stubbornly indecisive guy, you know that? If you have something to say to me, say it now, and clearly.
ko: 너 진짜 우유부단하다, 알아? 할 말 있으면 지금 똑바로 해.

en: When I lifted a potted plant in my garden, there were swarms of little insects crawling underneath, and I instinctively let out a shriek.
ko: 마당에서 화분을 들었는데 그 밑에 벌레들이 바글바글 기어 다녀서 나도 모르게 비명을 질렀어.

en: I’m glad I had a thoroughly open and honest talk with him. I feel so relieved.
ko: 걔랑 속 시원하게 다 털어놓고 얘기해서 다행이야. 이제 마음이 좀 놓여.

en: Because of yesterday's heavy snow, the ground is very slippery. As soon as I stepped outside, I slipped and fell on my bottom.
ko: 어제 눈이 많이 와서 길이 엄청 미끄러워. 밖으로 나가자마자 미끄러져서 엉덩방아 찧었어.

en: I was looking forward to seeing a scenic view of Mt. Fuji, but unfortunately it was completely hidden behind clouds.
ko: 후지산 경치 볼 생각에 기대했는데, 아쉽게도 구름에 완전히 가려져 있더라.

en: I have absolutely no clue what happened after I got drunk. Why is there some old dude sleeping in my room?
ko: 술 취하고 나서 어떻게 됐는지 하나도 기억 안 나. 왜 모르는 아저씨가 내 방에서 자고 있는 거야?

en: Due to the typhoon, the train schedule was disturbed and all the trains were jam-packed.
ko: 태풍 때문에 열차 시간표가 꼬여서 기차가 다 꽉 찼어.

en: This girl is still in elementary school, yet she has a wine-tasting master license. I didn't know one could get qualified without even drinking alcohol.
ko: 이 애는 초등학생인데 벌써 와인 소믈리에 자격증이 있대. 술도 안 마시고 자격증을 딸 수 있는 줄은 몰랐네.

en: You don't have the guts.
You don't have what it takes to be a leader.
Check out that woman!
Even though I summoned my courage and invited Mary to a movie, she gave me the slip.
ko: 용기 내서 메리한테 영화 보자고 했는데, 걔가 나를 따돌렸어.

en: Even though I plucked up courage to invite Mary to a film, she stood me up.
ko: 큰맘 먹고 메리한테 영화 보자고 했는데, 걔가 나를 바람 맞혔어.

en: The racket slipped from my hands and broke itself on the court when I made the serve.
ko: 서브 넣을 때 라켓이 손에서 미끄러져서 코트 바닥에 부딪혀 부서졌어.

en: I don't have much interest in sports games like soccer or baseball, but I do like seeing weird or outstanding plays in them.
ko: 축구나 야구 같은 스포츠 경기에는 별 관심 없는데, 가끔 나오는 특이하거나 대단한 장면들 보는 건 좋아해.

en: I was going to take a picture of a squirrel I found in the park, but it was too nimble, and all my shots were no good.
ko: 공원에서 발견한 다람쥐 사진을 찍으려고 했는데, 너무 빨라서 제대로 찍힌 게 하나도 없어.

en: Motorbikes are nice. You can move smoothly even through a traffic jam.
ko: 오토바이는 좋아. 길이 막혀도 슉슉 잘 빠져나가잖아.

en: Motorcycles are great. They can easily get through even in heavy traffic.
ko: 오토바이는 진짜 편해. 차가 아무리 막혀도 사이사이로 잘 가거든.

en: Penguins look strange when they waddle on land, but the way they swim so smoothly through the water is pretty cool.
ko: 펭귄은 땅에서 뒤뚱뒤뚱 걸을 때는 이상해 보이는데, 물속에서 매끄럽게 수영하는 모습은 진짜 멋있어.

en: Takashi said he wasn't afraid of ghosts, but when he heard some sounds from the supposedly empty second floor, he quickly scrambled away.
ko: 타카시는 귀신 안 무섭다고 하더니, 비어있어야 할 2층에서 소리가 들리니까 후다닥 도망가더라.

en: The only thing he did before he briskly went on ahead was give us a map. The remainder of us could only rely on the map to figure out where to go.
ko: 걔는 우리한테 지도 하나만 주고는 쌩 하니 가버렸어. 남겨진 우리는 지도에만 의지해서 길을 찾아야 했지.

en: He just gave us a map and sprinted ahead. We who were left behind had to go on with just the map to rely on.
ko: 걔가 지도만 던져주고 먼저 뛰어가는 바람에, 남은 사람들은 지도 하나에 의지해서 갈 수밖에 없었어.

en: Even though our house was on TV, I'd prefer it if you wouldn't just barge in our garden and take pictures.
ko: 우리 집이 TV에 나왔다고는 해도, 마당에 함부로 들어와서 사진 찍고 그러지는 않았으면 좋겠어.

en: Emiko never thinks about others' feelings and always says things too bluntly, so everyone hates her.
ko: 에미코는 남의 기분은 생각도 안 하고 너무 직설적으로 말해서 다들 걔를 싫어해.

en: My son likes books about animals.
Don't sniffle, please quickly blow your nose.
ko: 코 훌쩍거리지 말고 빨리 코 풀어.

en: According to her, he is a coward.
According to my teacher, I'm a good pupil.
In my opinion, he is just a fool.
Tom scrubbed his feet.
I can't keep up with you. Could you dictate a bit slower?
ko: 속도를 못 따라가겠어. 조금만 더 천천히 불러줄래?

en: Tom set a trap.
Tom set me up.
Tom ruined my weekend.
I don't want either of them.
Give me five minutes to finish the last adjustments.
There are many slums in Mexico.
You mistook the salt for sugar and put it in your coffee?! How careless can you get?
ko: 소금을 설탕인 줄 알고 커피에 넣었다고? 너 진짜 덜렁댄다.

en: Not even going to work, do you want to keep living like this?
ko: 일도 안 가고, 계속 이렇게 살고 싶은 거야?

en: The unkempt girl was completely unable to keep things neat and tidy.
ko: 그 꾀죄죄한 애는 정리 정돈을 하나도 못 하더라.

en: I think that there are more people in the countryside with a big heart than there are in the city.
ko: 도시보다 시골에 마음씨 넉넉한 사람들이 더 많은 것 같아.

en: Tom remained silent.
Tom remained single his whole life.
I'm glad to be with you.
No?
Isn't it true?
Please remember to put out the fire before you go home.
ko: 집에 가기 전에 불 끄는 거 꼭 기억해.

en: Please don't forget to put out the fire before you go home.
ko: 집에 가기 전에 불 끄는 거 잊지 마.

en: Is there anyone who wants some more pie?
ko: 파이 더 먹고 싶은 사람 있어?

en: Jimmy begged me to take him to the zoo.
I left my gloves in the library.
Isn't "Sloppy Joe" someone's name?
Do you know how to drive?
Can you use a computer?
It's up to you to decide what to do.
Give us this day our daily bread, and forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors.
ko: 오늘 우리에게 필요한 양식을 주시고, 우리가 우리에게 잘못한 사람들을 용서한 것처럼 우리 죄도 용서해 줘.

en: I don't like being treated as a child.
You rarely ever wake up this early.
ko: 너 이렇게 일찍 일어나는 일이 거의 없는데.

en: Once in a while, we should take a step back and think.
ko: 가끔은 한 걸음 물러나서 생각할 필요가 있어.

en: I'd like to talk to Jean.
It's the dynamic interaction between the characters that makes this novel so great.
ko: 캐릭터들 사이의 역동적인 상호작용이 이 소설을 정말 훌륭하게 만들어.

en: There's too much sugar in the coffee.
He has a good sense of feeling.
You are my true friend!
I'm hungry because I haven't had lunch.
I worked a lot this week.
ko: 이번 주에 일을 정말 많이 했어.

en: I would like you to translate this book into English.
ko: 이 책을 영어로 번역해 줬으면 좋겠어.

en: Sentences can teach us a lot. Much more than just words.
ko: 문장은 우리에게 많은 걸 가르쳐 줘. 단어보다 훨씬 더 많이.

en: Wake me up at seven o'clock.
I'm really looking forward to seeing you.
ko: 너 만나는 거 정말 기대하고 있어.

en: I was bitten by a lot of insects in the forest.
It's OK with me if you take that book.
It doesn't bother me if you take that book.
ko: 그 책 가져가도 난 신경 안 써.

en: It doesn't matter to me if you take that book.
He doesn't want to speak, being afraid of making mistakes.
ko: 걔는 실수할까 봐 말하는 걸 겁내.

en: You aren't qualified to be the leader.
I have absolutely no intention of paying ten dollars.
I had a weird dream last night.
Last night I had a strange dream.
My headache has gone away.
Tom has an organ donor card in his wallet.
ko: 톰 지갑에 장기 기증 카드가 있어.

en: Is tomorrow Saturday?
Tom got paint on his shirt while he was painting the fence.
ko: 톰은 울타리 칠하다가 셔츠에 페인트가 묻었어.

en: Tom always keeps a set of jumper cables in the trunk of his car.
ko: 톰은 차 트렁크에 항상 점퍼 케이블을 가지고 다녀.

en: Tomorrow is Saturday, February 5th, 2011.
She is Japanese.
Tom managed a small bar near Boston for quite a long time.
ko: 톰은 꽤 오랫동안 보스턴 근처에서 작은 바를 운영했어.

en: I don't understand what he wants me to do.
ko: 걔가 나한테 뭘 하라는 건지 모르겠어.

en: I found the gloves that were under the chair.
He made up his mind to become a pilot.
Yeah, I want you to do it.
This door is locked from the inside.
I was worried about you.
